name: Email Service
description: Salsify microservice that consumes email requests from Kafka and sends email via Postmark. Handles email templating, delivery, deduplication, and recipient validation including checking for disabled Dandelion users. Supports domain/email whitelisting for non-production environments and distinguishes between permanent failures (unrecoverable) and transient failures (retriable).

name: Email Service Client
description: Ruby gem providing a thin client API for sending emails via the Email Service. Supports multiple delivery modes: Transactional (writes to event_publisher_events table for async Kafka publishing), Direct (sends directly to Kafka), and Trap (testing mode that doesn't send).

name: Postmark
description: Third-party email delivery service used by Salsify for templating and delivery of emails. Templates use Mustachio syntax and should be named in lisp-case. All templates belong in the 'Salsify Production' server regardless of environment.

name: Infrastructure Management Platform
description: Salsify internal platform for managing infrastructure and services. Used to monitor and manage deployments of services like the Email Service.

name: Continuous Deployment
description: Deployment practice where commits on master are automatically deployed to production. Used by services like the Email Service with deploy notifications sent to team channels.

name: Dandelion
description: Salsify internal system for user management. The Email Service checks Dandelion to determine if users are disabled before sending emails to them. Emails are not sent to disabled Dandelion users.
